name: Signal Strength Parameter Estimation for Higgs Boson Events
description: Estimate the signal strength parameter (µ) for Higgs boson events in simulated high-energy physics data, producing a 68.27% Confidence Interval (CI) while accounting for systematic uncertainties.

cr:input.name: competition_dataset
cr:input.description: Apache Parquet dataset with 280 million rows, each representing a simulated collision event. Features include primary quantities (e.g., PRI_had_pt, PRI_met) and derived quantities (e.g., DER_mass_transverse_met_lep). Example values: PRI_had_pt ~23-26 GeV, PRI_met ~0-100 GeV, DER_mass_transverse_met_lep ~0-100 GeV.

cr:output.name: confidence_intervals
cr:output.description: 68.27% Confidence Interval bounds for the signal strength parameter µ. Format: [µ16, µ84]. Example: [0.5, 1.2].

field.name: id
field.description: Unique identifier for the pseudo-experiment, e.g., experiment_001

field.name: mu16
field.description: Lower bound of the 68.27% Confidence Interval for µ

field.name: mu84
field.description: Upper bound of the 68.27% Confidence Interval for µ

cr:evaluation.notes: Final quantile score combines interval width and coverage into a single score. Smaller interval widths and coverage closer to 68.27% are better.

open_questions: What is the exact URL for the FAIR Universe HiggsML Uncertainty Dataset?
What are the exact memory limits for submissions?
Are participants allowed to use external data for training or validation?
What are the exact versions of Python packages required (e.g., xgboost, torch)?
What is the expected Docker image or environment setup for Codabench evaluation?
fill_in_the_blank: cr:input[0].url - dataset URL not specified in paper
cr:execution.allowedExternalData - external data usage policy not specified
